briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Oxycodone/Naloxone Controlled-release Tablets (OXN) Compared to Placebo in Opioid-experienced Subjects With Moderate to Severe Chronic Low Back Pain
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Trial With an Enriched Study Design to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Oxycodone/Naloxone Controlled-release Tablets (OXN) Compared to Placebo in Opioid-experienced Subjects With Moderate to Severe Pain Due to Chronic Low Back Pain Who Require Around-the-clock Opioid Therapy
summary: The primary objective of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of OXN compared to placebo in opioid-experienced subjects with moderate to severe pain due to chronic low back pain who require around-the-clock opioid therapy.

primaryOutcome.measure: The "Average Pain Over the Last 24 Hours" at Week 12 of the Double-blind Period
